pageContext.claim: “We're not doing that. Politicians in Washington are saying, Oh, you don't… -- they don't know the first thing about -- they've never been here.”
pageContext.analysis: This is nonsense. Multiple lawmakers from both parties have visited the U.S.-Mexico border in the last year. Congressional Democrats hosted a round table there on June 18, 2018 and Sen. Jeff Merkley's (D-Ore.) visit started the initial outrage over the president's family separation policy.
